page.title: 17HUMSHAUGH SHEPHERD'S DIARY
page.content: TUESDAY IS{MARKET}DAY AT HEXHAM SO ON THE EVENING BEFORE THE FAT LAMBS DUE TO BE SOLD ARE MARKED. THE{SHEPHERD ROSE AT 7.00 A.M. AND BY 7.30 A.M. WAS LOADING 44{LAMBS}INTO THE TRAILER. THEY PROVED DIFFICULT TO LOAD JUMPING THE SIDES OF THE RAMP TO THE TRAILER AND IT TOOK UNTIL 8.30 A.M. IN ORDER TO AVOID THE DELAYS DUE TO ROAD WORKS ON TYNE BRIDGE, HEXHAM, THE SHEPHERD DECIDED TO MAKE THE DETOUR THROUGH WARDEN BUT HE CAME ACROSS A ROAD ACCIDENT ON THE A69 AND WAS DELAYED FURTHER, REACHING MARKET AT 11.00 A.M. THE LAMBS WERE THEN GRADED ACHIEVED THE GRADE ANTICIPATED AND THEN RE- PENNED. THE SHEPHERD HAD LUNCH AND TALKED TO FRIENDS UNTIL THEY WERE TO BE AUCTIONED AT 3.00 P.M. THE{PRICE REACHED WAS FAIRLY GOOD AT 158p PER KILO. HE THEN CAME HOME, CHECKED THE REMAINING FLOCK UNTIL 6.00 P.M.
